thread.title: Lake Berryessa: The gigantic flood drain that looks like a portal into another dimension
thread.title_full: Lake Berryessa: The gigantic flood drain that looks like a portal into another dimension

title: Lake Berryessa: The gigantic flood drain that looks like a portal into another dimension
text:
Hundreds took up a perch on the side of the lake to watch the mesmerising show, the NYT reported. EVAN KILKUS/AOL 
The bellmouth has roared to life for the first time in 10 years. 
It's a drone lover's dream. 
The spotlight's been on California's dams after America's tallest at Lake Oroville started to fail earlier this month . 
Those who run Monticello Dam say the whirlpool is perfectly normal. 
The Berryessa spillway is known as a "bellmouth", but is also called a morning glory, plug hole or a glory hole, as the locals refer to it. Ad Feedback 
When water rises more than 134m above sea level in the lake, it spills over the lip of the, funnels down the cone and exits into Putah Creek, on the other side of the Monticello Dam. 
On Wednesday (NZT), water was flowing down the whirlpool at around 7.5 million litres a minute, the NYT reported. 
It can flow a lot faster but at the moment the chances of ending up in another dimension are very low - the pull of the current around the drain is so slow that the average swimmer could swim away from it. - Stuff
